result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Dobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Count #2.  Consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, restitution and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.   Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 423, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.
Defendant shall maintain full time employment.  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 30 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.

Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

BAIL JUMP - FELONY, POSS NARCOTIC DRUGS, POSS DRUG PARA; CONDITIONS:    NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ILLEGAL CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION.  NO DRIVING WITHOUT VALID DRIVER'S LICENSE.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL.
